body_html: @emerali I can provide initialization functions for sparse. Can I ask what specific Modules and operations are needed for your use case? Please note that when local gradients of an operation (e.g., mm(S, D)) is dense, we only provide a sparse version of it (e.g., sparse_mm(S, D)), where only nnz weights will get updated during backward.
body_text: @emerali I can provide initialization functions for sparse. Can I ask what specific Modules and operations are needed for your use case? Please note that when local gradients of an operation (e.g., mm(S, D)) is dense, we only provide a sparse version of it (e.g., sparse_mm(S, D)), where only nnz weights will get updated during backward.
body: @emerali I can provide initialization functions for sparse. Can I ask what specific Modules and operations are needed for your use case? Please note that when local gradients of an operation (e.g., `mm(S, D)`) is dense, we only provide a sparse version of it (e.g., `sparse_mm(S, D)`), where only nnz weights will get updated during backward.
